attributes.action: Remove the sugary snacks from vending machines in children sport centres
attributes.additional_details: Many leisure centres have vending machines full of snacks high in sugar in the reception/waiting area. The  NHS strongly suggests us to reduce sugar for our children. I strongly believe that is not  right to put sugar in front of a tired child and have to tell them that you shouldn't have it. One in four children in the UK is overwight.
attributes.background: If I take my children to swimming pool or a gymnastic class is because I want them to be healthy and not have them see just in front of them high sugar snacks that are many times present in the reception/waiting area. What is going to be: the big tantrum for a no sugar or the sugary treat.

rejection.details: This would be the responsibility of the management of individual leisure centres, not the Government or Parliament.
